Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with two pairs of added white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of siren (part of body with dotted scale pattern, wing and leg), to right; dotted rosette as filling ornament; below, part of two narrow bands.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 264, no. 554, pl. 68)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0513) (phase 2)
